title: How Islamology stepped out of French academia's shadows after the 2015 jihadist attacks
subhead: Once a jewel of French research, Islamology began to decline in the 1980s, but the 2015 attacks forced authorities to refocus their efforts in this field of knowledge. Although the discipline has since experienced something of a revival, its recovery remains fragile, both as an academic subject and a highly political issue.

title: Long-lost Rubens 'masterpiece' sells for almost 3 million euros
subhead: The work, of Jesus Christ on the cross and painted in 1613, was unearthed by auctioneer Jean-Pierre Osenat in a Paris mansion last year.

title: Buyers of underage sex are rarely prosecuted: 'We are at ground zero of the criminal justice response'
subhead: The French justice system estimates that 15,000 girls under the age of 18 are sexually exploited in France. The criminal response has focused on dismantling pimping networks, even though clients can also face criminal prosecution for the rape of minors when the victims are under 15 years old.
byline: Lorraine de Foucher ,  Lucie Soullier and  Thomas Saintourens

The last-minute fight to save Gaza's ancient archaeological treasures
subhead: Amid the vast destruction of the war, a small group of determined individuals fought to save Gaza's archaeological heritage. On September 10, they secured a few hours' reprieve from the Israeli army before a storage depot filled with artifacts was bombed to perform a delicate evacuation – the result of intense, high-level negotiations.

title: Can French citizens be mobilized in the event of war?
subhead: Statements by General Fabien Mandon and President Emmanuel Macron's announcements about a voluntary national service have raised questions about a scenario that, until recently, seemed unimaginable.

title: Paris restaurants with a New York attitude
subhead: The French capital has recently seen a wave of New York-style restaurants spring up, from slice shops to delis and red sauce joints. Parisians are flocking to these spots to savor not only a slice of culinary culture but also the enduring myth of the Big Apple.
